We provide a personalised approach to education for our 1400 students from Reception to Year 13.  As an employer, we offer a supportive environment with opportunities for professional growth and development. §About the role:§St Cuthbert’s College invites applications for the position of Art Technician within our very successful Art Faculty.§The role ensures the smooth running of the Faculty and provides effective support for the HOF and Staff. The job includes preparing resources for art lessons, sourcing and ordering of art supplies, administration duties including the payment of invoices via the Accounts Department and the running of the Art Faculty shop. The Art Technician provides support for students needing materials or technical direction, catalogues the art books, maintains equipment and is involved in the smooth running of Art Exhibitions, both NCEA and of IB. The job includes photographing and /or scanning of NCEA examination material and keeping records of students' work for the Art Faculty. The technician helps with the layout of the art pages displayed in the College Chronicle. The job is busy and varied. The applicant needs to have excellent organisational skills, must be a clear communicator and must be adaptable. Strong collaboration skills are essential. An interest and some work experience in the Visual Arts is desirable. Any art related skills eg Knowledge of the Adobe Suite or confident Photographic knowledge are an advantage.§Applications close on 13 October 2020.§§§§

As a Media Advisor you will be managing these media queries and relationships with media outlets nationally. You will be self-managing, confident, and calm under pressure. You will also need to have sound judgement and can think critically. §        §This role works on a rostered shift basis as the Police Media Centre operates seven days a week from 6am to 11pm. §        §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §          §Liaising with media and district and executive staff §          §Preparing media responses and media monitoring §          §Reporting and developing content for social media §          §Assisting with media conferences§        §        §        §        §What you’ll bring§        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.§        §        §          §A good understanding of the New Zealand media and social media environment§          §Experience in a communications team or with media/social media§          §Understanding of the machinery of government is beneficial§          §Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance to secret level§          §Available for rostered shift work: the media centre operates seven days a week§          §Available for rostered work for after-hours calls for urgent issues§          §Willingness to participate in wider all-of-Government communications responses for critical incident and counter terrorism events§          §Travel as required and sometimes at short notice§          §Relevant qualifications in communications and journalism is desirable§        §        §        §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§        §        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§        §        §        §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:§ §        §https://teams.sp.police.govt.nz/pac/od/pd/Documents/Strategy%20and%20Service/Media%20Advisor.pdf §        §        §        §About us§        §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. §        §        §        §Working Flexibly§        §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. §        §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        §        §How to apply§        §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form and a chronological list of previous roles that covers the role title and the date/duration (this is a mandatory requirement and replaces a CV). Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. As a Media Advisor you will be managing these media queries and relationships with media outlets nationally. You will be self-managing, confident, and calm under pressure. You will also need to have sound judgement and can think critically. § §This role works on a rostered shift basis as the Police Media Centre operates seven days a week from 6am to 11pm. § § §Key Accountabilities:§ §Liaising with media and district and executive staff § §Preparing media responses and media monitoring § §Reporting and developing content for social media § §Assisting with media conferences§ § § §What you’ll bring§ §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.§ § §A good understanding of the New Zealand media and social media environment§ §Experience in a communications team or with media/social media§ §Understanding of the machinery of government is beneficial§ §Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance to secret level§ §Available for rostered shift work: the media centre operates seven days a week§ §Available for rostered work for after-hours calls for urgent issues§ §Willingness to participate in wider all-of-Government communications responses for critical incident and counter terrorism events§ §Travel as required and sometimes at short notice§ §Relevant qualifications in communications and journalism is desirable§ § §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§ § §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. § §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§ § §How to apply§ §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. jobText: TXT/50865265.txt	§Absolute Legend Required for Self Confidence Programme§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Absolute Legend Required for Self Confidence Programme§§Advertiser: §Marrzipan Drama§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Performing Arts§§§§§§§Are you a rockstar (or think you are)?!§ §We run a revolutionary self-confidence program across schools in New Zealand. Our company has spread like wildfire across the country, and due to this rapid growth, we are now on the hunt for another superstar to join our team. The team are young, ambitious and motivated (sound like you?) and have a natural flair for public speaking and working with children. § §Full training of the Marrzipan Method of teaching will be provided, but we can't train §personality§! If you are a little bit crazy, but with your head screwed on at the same time, we want to hear from you! Hard work, passion and commitment are immediately noticed and rewarded. § §About the position:§ §We are looking for a charismatic and enthusiastic role model, who exudes energy, isn't afraid to look really silly, can promote in front of large audiences with ease, can be professional in meetings with Principals and has the "X Factor" that children are drawn to. You may not have ALL of these skills, but have enough faith in yourself that (with some training), you would nail all of these areas.§ §We are currently recruiting for positions in Auckland and Christchurch, but with the opportunity to move/relocate (either within NZ or overseas) and amazing career opportunities down the track. Applicants must have their own car and license in order to apply for this role. § §You will be working autonomously and remotely - any office work will be done from your own home, with regular online meetings with the Marrzipan team. The ability to "crack on" and get things done without constant supervision is a must!§ §Duties & responsibilities:§ § §Speak in assemblies with 400+ teachers and students § §Teach our classes with provided Lesson Plans§ §Direct short 15 minute plays with provided scripts § §Host/MC performances of the plays as your students perform to their parents and school§ §Intense training in the Marrzipan Method of teaching provided § §This role enables you to "sell" something you are truly passionate about, and follow through to actually deliver and teach the service you are selling. You will help children to develop their self-confidence and self-belief through high-quality lessons, and get new schools on board so that more and more children can benefit from this unique program. This role is immensely rewarding, and you will go home at the end of the day feeling like you truly made a positive impact on the world. § §The ideal applicant answers yes to all these questions...§ § §Natural ability with children § §Are you one of those people that children are instantly drawn to at a family gathering? Are you the unofficial "Aunty/Uncle" to all the children you know? Can you keep a room full of children fully engaged and entertained all day? Do you have natural discipline that keeps you in charge and them listening to you, without being boring and affecting the fun? § § §Professionalism§ §Are you confident when you're put on the spot and never lost for words? Can you walk in to a professional meeting and totally nail it? If you are passionate about something and believe in it, can you convince people that they should try it?§ § §Confident speaking in front of large groups§ §Do all your friends ask you to be the MC at their wedding? Are you the best wing-man/woman in town because of your ability to go up to anyone and start talking to them? Can you command a large group of people with ease? Are you confident and charismatic on stage in front of an audience?§ § §An infectious sense of humour§ §Can you make people laugh? Can you make §children§ laugh?!§ § §X-Factor§ §Do you have it?§ §The following experience/skills are desired but not essential:§ § §Teaching experience§ §Performing/drama background§ §Excellent, clear and concise verbal and written communication skills§ §Professional and articulate§ §Able to work productively independently, and use own initiative§ §Passionate about children's education and development, particularly Marrzipan's philosophy and teaching method (check out our website)§ §This is a job for people who are 'going places' and want a company they can move their career forward with. We take care of our staff and hard work is appreciated and quickly rewarded. We will compromise experience, but NOT personality. If you KNOW you would ace this job, get in touch with us, no matter what your background.§ §Remuneration§ §Base salary + fuel allowance + car maintenance + Apple laptop + iPhone + unlimited standard calls and 5GB data per month.§ §(Total package value: $50,000-$60,000)§ §How to apply§ §Email our Recruitment Manager, §recruitment@marrzipandrama.co.nz§ with:§ §- Your relevant CV§ §- A video of yourself (or link to one) 1-3 minutes long, that shows us your weird and wonderful PERSONALITY and why you would be awesome for this job!§ § §Applications without a video will not be considered!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

At WhitebaitMedia we pride ourselves on our sense of whanau, and our commitment to the tamariki of New Zealand.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We are on the lookout for a talented and experienced Field Director who can coordinate and direct stories in the field. jobText: TXT/50925196.txt	§Account Executive - Database & Engagement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Account Executive - Database & Engagement§§Advertiser: §Business Central & Wellington Chamber of Commerce§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§Who we are:§Our organisation is the voice of business in the central region of New Zealand, representing employers in Wairarapa, Manawatu, Hawke’s Bay, Gisborne, Taranaki, Nelson, Porirua and Wellington.  The organisation is one of the four regional organisations that make up BusinessNZ and is accredited through the New Zealand Chambers of Commerce network.§Position Summary:§The Account Executive – Database & Engagement is responsible for the provision of a range of services and products that help build member engagement with Business Central, the Wellington Chamber of Commerce and the Porirua Chamber of Commerce and for delivering accurate reporting for the wider organization from our CRM system.§The focus of the Membership Engagement Team is ‘REG’§: § §Retain, Engage and Grow§. REG includes self-managed activities along with those which support other members of the Membership Team and collaboration across teams to achieve targeted results.§Alongside this, the integrity of the CRM database is pivotal to our business.  Without accurate data and the ability to be able to extract that data in a meaningful way, we cannot provide the level of service our members expect from us, nor can we continue to grow our membership & service base. §Your main responsibilities will include:§Oversee the administration of the membership database so that business continuity and data integrity is assured at a high level and reporting of data is accurate§Active involvement in all customer service, administration, registration functions conducted within the Membership Engagement Team to ensure business continuity§Proactively seek out opportunities for membership growth throughout the wider Wellington region so that membership and revenue targets are achieved§Undertake any reporting requirements in a timely and professional manner including for senior management, the board and members of the wider team§Oversee the billing process ensuring billing is accurate, timely and that any outstanding debt is followed up§Contribute to the retention of members§Active involvement in the engagement and growth strategies developed by the Membership Engagement Team i.e. engaging members in the various income streams to ensure organisational targets are optimised (REG)§Educate, communicate and promote the organisation’s offerings and services to ensure targets are delivered§Contribute to and co-ordinate customer/member leads§Contribute actively to the continuous improvement of the organisation’s services, systems and resources with a particular focus on customer service§Key skills:§Intermediate Level Microsoft Office suite including databases§Demonstrated business development and sales experience§Demonstrated experience in a customer service role§Excellent analytical skills and judgement§Strong relationship management and networking skills§Excellent communications skills, including written, verbal and listening skills§Significant experience in a role requiring extensive organisation skills, multi-tasking and prioritisation of tasks§Ability to manage projects to a deadline§Flexibility and adaptability§Ability to work under pressure§Able to occasionally work beyond normal office hours§This is a full-time permanent position. Applicants must have the right to work in New Zealand.§For a more comprehensive job description please contact Emily Lake – §emily.lake@businesscentral.org.nz§. Please do not e-mail your CV and application.§Please apply via the SEEK website by sending your curriculum vitae and cover letter to Emily Lake, Operations Manager.§Applications close at 9am Tuesday 24th 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of B2B sales experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as an account manager?§§§

jobText: TXT/50904843.txt	§Digital Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Account Manager§§Advertiser: §iDigital§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Agency Account Management§§§§§§iDigital is a boutique digital marketing agency located on K’Rd in Auckland. Through innovation and their brand stories they have transformed New Zealand Merino into premium branded fibre and meat sought after by discerning customers globally.§ §We need an experienced superstar to:§ § §Develop, create and deliver quality creative solutions for multiple brands and internal teams§ §Guide the look and feel for creative print design, presentations, motion design, digital experiences, and other marketing collateral§ §Align creative concepts and interactive design with marketing strategy and brand direction§ §Work alongside brands to maximise long term opportunities§ §Relevant experience and attitude§ §You will have a minimum of 7 years’ experience and have a strong portfolio show casing your design, creative thinking, and implementation of projects.  Industry experience working in a busy, dynamic and fluid environment will be a key.§ §You will have the ‘X factor’ when it comes to picking up concepts, mixing this with your creative genius and producing quality creative outcomes for both our brands and internal teams.  You will have strong communication skills and enjoy contributing to new ideas using your innovation and imagination to think outside of the box. § §We are looking for someone who is a self-starter, forward thinking, flexible to change and is highly organised.  You will enjoy good banter and being part of a team.    § §Although not essential, experience with video editing and Adobe Creative suite would be desirable.  Competent with other forms of technology and keeping up with design trends will see your success in this role, as would the ability to use design thinking.§ §This is a highly attractive opportunity to work for a leading organisation, who proactively push the boundaries of innovation within the primary sector.§ §Sounds like you, then apply§ §In strict confidence, please click on ‘apply now’. For a copy of the position description please see the careers section of our website www.nzmerino.co.nz§ §Applications will close on 30 November, unless an appointment is made earlier.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50932784.txt	§Senior Digital Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Digital Account Manager§§Advertiser: §BAIXING LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$75,000 - $84,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Advertising, Arts & Media§, §Media Strategy, Planning & Buying§§§§§§About us§ § § §Shenma.nz is one of the most influential Chinese media in New Zealand, dedicated to adding value to Chinese New Zealanders community. Shenma provide precise and quality information covering used car trade, second-hand furniture trade, rental property, education and travelling among others. Shenma have over 280,000 local Chinese speaking users on a monthly basis and the user base has been growing. We also provide advertising services, including design, media channels, publish articles, promotions and  advertising strategy. We have our own creative team and partnerships with many other large online media firms.§ § § §Qualifications & experience§ § § §Extensive prior advertisement account management experience, minimum 5 years of working experience would be ideal, with a proven track record§Relevant degree in business management or marketing§Proven negotiation and relationship management skills and ability to build strategic business relationships§Bilingual (English and Chinese) is a plus§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ § § §Identify and generate new business, and support the business growth of the Company§Implementation of campaigns to actively promote the company's name products and services§Maintain and manage a customer portfolio of online advertising campaigns and optimising the success of these§Develop effective marketing campaigns for clients that reach the right target, create customer awareness and promote their goods and services with the use of appropriate artwork, copywriting, ad positioning and that fit with clients' budget§Advise clients on advertising campaigns based on the data and research to reach a more targeted markets, creating consumer awareness and effectively promoting clients' goods and service§Create monthly advertising campaign reports and analyse data regarding customers patterns and preferences, ability to evaluate the effectiveness of online campaigns and recommend areas for improvement§Research and analysis of current and future consumer trends to create and plan for appropriate advertising campaigns for clients§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an account manager?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Optimisation (SEO)?§Do you have experience with Search Engine Marketing (SEM)?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§
